basic.floral_language:
Parthenocissus tricuspidata 
Floriography: tenacious, vigorous, perseverant
Parthenocissus tricuspidata is a deciduous woody vine of beautiful leaf appearance, clinging to the wall by suckers, similar to pairs of feet, vivid and lovely. Often used as three-dimensional decorative material for green walls, park rockeries, can absorb dusts.
Parthenocissus tricuspidata is a shade-tolerant plant, but not afraid of strong light, grows best in the shade. When conditions are right. Flowers in May to June sometimes with orange flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in May-June, orange yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, turn to red in autumn and winter

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Resistant to shade plant, it is better for growth under shade
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, spray frequently to the air or leaves to keep moist in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
